info.title: Procurement Project Management for Users
info.description:
Use this service to retrieve project, subproject, and item data with a signed-in user. Most of the entities are in read-only mode. The only exception is the Item Investments entity, which enables you to read and update investment data.
## Rate Limitations
This API is rate limited to 1000 requests per hour and 10000 requests per day.

x-sap-shortText: This service enables you to retrieve project, subproject, and item data with a signed-in user

externalDocs.description: More information is available at the SAP S/4HANA for procurement planning SAP Help Portal page.

tags.name: Item Investment Version And Current Amounts

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_BatchRequests).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET Projects HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--

400.description: Bad Request: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g. malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

401.description: Unauthorized: The user does not have valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

403.description: Forbidden: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action. This may be due to the user not having the necessary permissions for a resource or needing an account of some sort, or attempting a prohibited action (e.g. creating a duplicate record where only one is allowed).

404.description: Not Found: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: A request method is not supported for the requested resource; for example, a GET request on a form that requires data to be presented via POST, or a PUT request on a read-only resource.

406.description: Not Acceptable: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.
